intro: Viola incompta, commonly known as the American violet, is a species native to North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, delicate flowers in shades of purple, pink, or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade. Viola incompta is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
